column4: oh ok... if it works like that I'd think that what you'd want to do is a clean install of windows, and then copy everything back over from the external hd... but from the limited info I have on the program (since I can't read the docs) it looks like its saying it copies everything so I thought that would mean the boot sector, probably what it does is not copy free space or empty space (which dd would)
or perhaps all you need is to copy all the files back over the ubuntu install, use a win bootdisk and do a fdisk /mbr (I think that is the right command)
what you don't be able to do of course is boot from the external drive (at least WIN XP won't... it protests and refuses to do so)

I wish I could be of more assistance, but I've not used any Windows myself for a while now and I'm so used to doing things the linux way such as with dd; does the documentation (if any) that comes with HDCopy tell you what it does?
